channel.title: Publishing
channel.description:
Hey everyone, I have a few book's that I have written, one actually from when I was only 15 and I have been looking into publishing them to make a little money on the side. I don't want them to go to paper back or anything, I just want to sell them as digital downloads like for the kindle and android market. Does anyone have any information on this or have actually published something? I don't want to do anything through a third party as I don't believe they should gain a % for just submitting something that I didn't know how to. Thanks everyone.
- Andrew

item.title: Publishing
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Look for a small Indie Book Publisher. They’ll probably release it on those things and maybe to a few small local stores…

Read full topic

item.description:
@mock_pro wrote:

you know, i know a few people in this kind of business, maybe i can get around to em and see what they gotta say?

Read full topic

item.title: Publishing
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

CoonHunter:

Google should give some insite as to how to become a published author via Android Market, although don’t expect to make much as nobody just browses books.

I’ve been doing research for a while and I can’t even find on the Google forums how people independently publish books.

Read full topic
